intro: Psychotria exigua, commonly known as the "devil's flower" or "soul's flower," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It contains various alkaloids, including psychotamine, which has psychoactive properties. Due to its unique chemical composition and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and pharmacologists alike.
